title: BlackRock files for spot bitcoin ETF, with Coinbase as a crypto custodian
description: The firm filed an application with the Securities and Exchange Commission to launch the iShares Bitcoin Trust.

title: Elon Musk met with Italy Prime Minister to talk A.I., birth rates, as hunt for new factory location continues
description: Elon Musk's meeting with Italy Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni comes as leaders in Europe attempt to woo the Tesla boss into investing in their countries.

title: Bitcoin briefly drops below $25,000, Tether's stablecoin falls under its dollar peg
description: Cryptocurrency prices plunged after the Federal Reserve's June meeting, with bitcoin falling below $25,000 for the first time since March.

title: Virgin Galactic to launch commercial space tourism service with late June flight
description: Virgin Galactic aims to launch its commercial space tourism service in late June, with a flight carrying members of the Italian Air Force.

title: Russian ransomware hacker extorted millions from U.S. businesses, prosecutors say
description: Ruslan Magomedovich Astamirov allegedly used the LockBit ransomware-as-a-service to target five businesses before his arrest by federal law enforcement.

title: Twitter has suspended the accounts of a prominent Tesla and Elon Musk critic, Plainsite founder Aaron Greenspan
description: Before he bought Twitter, Musk remarked, "I hope that even my worst critics remain on Twitter, because that is what free speech means."

title: Justice Department to probe PGA Tour deal with Saudi-funded LIV Golf
description: The announcement of the deal between LIV Golf and the PGA Tour last week immediately triggered antitrust concerns.

title: These early retirement advocates quit their jobs with plenty of money in the bank. Here are their tips for becoming financially independent
description: The FIRE movement, which stands for Financial Independence, Retire Early, is built on the idea that handling your money well can lead to financial freedom.

title: Ultra-long-haul flights are coming back. Qantas wants to break the record
description: Qantas has placed an order for new Airbus A350-1000 planes for nonstop flights between New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport and Sydney.

title: 'We’re all crazy when it comes to money,' advisor says. How to manage your psyche for better finances
description: Human brains are wired to make financial mistakes, behavioral experts said at CNBC's Financial Advisor Summit. Here's why.

title: 'You do have a bit of a bubble developing' with artificial intelligence, financial expert warns
description: AI may be overhyped at the moment, but Satori Fund founder Dan Niles believes it's actually not getting enough attention, given its long-term potential.

title: Toyota stock having best week since 2009 after annual meeting, new EV goals
description: Toyota's stock is having its best week since 2009 following the company disclosing plans for its next-gen EVs and shareholders voting in favor of its board.

title: Alibaba to launch local versions of its China e-commerce site in Europe
description: Launching Tmall in Europe reflects a significant shift in strategy for Alibaba in its international e-commerce operations.

title: Tesla's U.S. electric vehicle market share will drop to 18% by 2026, BofA estimates
description: BofA expects the market to shift significantly from new entrants, such as Tesla, to incumbent automakers.

title: Artificial intelligence is not yet as smart as a dog, Meta A.I. chief says
description: Meta's AI Chief Yann LeCun said in the future there will be machines that are more intelligent than humans but they should not be seen as a threat.

title: U.S. withdraws new charges in Sam Bankman-Fried case, punts them to 2024
description: Federal prosecutors asked a judge on Thursday to remove five charges against alleged crypto fraudster Sam Bankman-Fried.

title: Watch: ECB President Christine Lagarde speaks after rate decision
description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde will give a press conference following the bank's monetary policy decision Thursday.

title: European Central Bank raises rates by 25 basis points after Fed opts to pause
description: The European Central Bank raised rates on Thursday as it attempts to bring down persistently high inflation.

title: Ex-PM Boris Johnson deliberately misled UK parliament over parties during Covid, committee rules
description: Former U.K. prime minister Boris Johnson intentionally misled parliament over illegal Covid-19 lockdown parties held during his tenure, a parliamentary committee said Thursday.

title: $5 billion fintech Zepz looks to take on rivals like PayPal with digital wallet, M&A plans
description: Money transfer unicorn Zepz is looking to expand its business through mergers and acquisitions, the company's CEO Mark Lenhard told CNBC.

title: China to see the world's biggest millionaire exodus this year, new study shows
description: According to a report by investment migration consultancy Henley & Partners, China is expected to lose the largest number of dollar millionaires this year due to migration.

title: Microsoft's co-founder Bill Gates will reportedly meet China's Xi this week
description: Gates tweeted saying he had landed in Beijing to "visit with partners" working on global health and development challenges for the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

title: Asia inflation has peaked, region's growth to overtake U.S. and Europe, Morgan Stanley says
description: Asia's growth is set to outpace that of the U.S. and Europe's by the end of this year, says Morgan Stanley.

title: China's youth unemployment hits a fresh record high in May, major data disappoint
description: Authorities have started to loosen monetary policy in a bid to support growth, although broader measures aren't expected until top leaders hold a regular meeting in late July.

title: Chinese Tesla rival Xpeng gets approval to roll out driver-assist tech in Beijing
description: Chinese electric car brand Xpeng announced Thursday it received approval to start rolling out assisted driving tech to users in the nation's capital city.

title: China cuts a key policy rate for first time in 10 months as economic rebound cools
description: China's central bank lowered its key medium-term lending rates on Thursday, in a much anticipated move.

title: France sees global A.I. regulation ideas by the end of this year, wants to work with U.S. on tech laws
description: French President Emmanuel Macron called for "global regulation" around artificial intelligence, even as the European Union pushes forward with its own laws.

title: 'Bite of these higher rates is gaining traction almost every day,' KBW CEO Thomas Michaud warns
description: KBW CEO Thomas Michaud warns the economy hasn't fully absorbed higher interest rates yet.

title: Disney World is packed, but lines can be short — if you follow several tips
description: The easiest ways to avoid lines at Disney World cost money. But paying for them is worth every cent, says CNBC's Travel Editor Monica Pitrelli.
